Hi again,

Due to a system crash part of my message was lost :(

With regards to self-organization when building NN's there is another 
major problem and that is how to instill the network with functionality. 
With direct encoding the genome describes the functionality by 
describing the neurons, connections and connection weights directly. 
With self-organization I don't see this being possible, in biology AFAIK 
the resulting network provides a basic framework of connections that 
support reinforcement learning - and that learning is how functionality 
finds it's way into the network. This is a major shift from the NE 
techniques I have seen to date.

Colin.
